src:
Asyik! UMKM Bakal Dapat Pelatihan dari e-Commerce
05 Nov 2019, 10:12 by Anisa Indraini


Foto: Anisa Indraini

Jakarta - Produk-produk koperasi dan usaha mikro kecil menengah (UMKM) terus didorong untuk bisa meningkatkan daya saing hingga menembus pasar global. Salah satunya caranya dengan meningkatkan penjualan lewat e-commerce.Menteri Koperasi dan Usaha Kecil Menengah (UKM) Teten Masduki mengatakan pihaknya mendorong kerja sama dengan e-commerce untuk meningkatkan layanan digital di kalangan UMKM. Hal itu diharapkan bisa memperkuat kompetensi UMKM naik kelas. "Salah satu untuk memperbesar pasar UMKM kami akan kerja sama dengan perusahaan aplikasi yang menjual barang secara online. Jadi UMKM go online salah satu menjadi prioritas," kata Teten di kantornya, Selasa (5/11/2019).Hingga saat ini, e-commerce yang sudah diajak bekerja sama yakni Gojek, Tokopedia, hingga Bukalapak. Tidak menutup kemungkinan jika jumlah e-commerce tersebut akan terus bertambah. Terkait bentuk kerja samanya, nantinya pihak e-commerce akan memberikan pelatihan kepada UMKM agar produk-produk yang layak dijual secara online. "Supaya produk-produk UMKM bisa layak dijual di online. Soal sertifikasinya, soal kemasan, soal keberlanjutan supply nya, kapasitas produksi, banyak yang bisa kita lakukan," jelas Teten.Selain itu, kerja sama juga dilakukan dalam hal pembiayaan sehingga ada agregasi. Hal ini dilakukan untuk meningkatkan pertumbuhan Koperasi dan UMKM. "Nanti juga bisa di pembiayaan kerja samanya, supaya ada agregasi," tuturnya.Simak Video "Grab dan Bekraf Latih 400 Pengusaha Mikro Kelola Bisnis Digital"[Gambas:Video 20detik](fdl/fdl)
text:
Fun! UMKM Will Get Training from e-Commerce
05 Nov 2019, 10:12 by Anisa Indraini


Photo: Anisa Indraini

Jakarta - Cooperative products and micro small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) are continuously encouraged to be able to increase competitiveness to penetrate the global market. One of the ways is by increasing sales through e-commerce. Minister of Cooperatives and Small and Medium Enterprises (UKM) Teten Masduki said that his party encourages cooperation with e-commerce to improve digital services among MSMEs. It is expected to strengthen the competence of MSMEs in the next grade. "One of the ways to enlarge the MSME market is that we will collaborate with an application company that sells goods online. So MSMEs going online is one of the priorities," Teten said in his office on Tuesday (11/05/2019). Until now, e- commerce that has been invited to work together namely Gojek, Tokopedia, to Bukalapak. Did not rule out the possibility if the number of e-commerce will continue to grow. Related to the form of cooperation, e-commerce will provide training to MSMEs so that products that are worthy of being sold online. "So that MSME products can be worthy of being sold online. About the certification, about packaging, about the sustainability of supply, production capacity, we can do a lot," Teten explained. In addition, cooperation is also carried out in terms of financing so that there is aggregation. This is done to increase the growth of cooperatives and MSMEs. "Later you can also fund cooperation, so there is aggregation," he said. Watch Video "Grab and Bekraf Train 400 Micro Businessmen to Manage Digital Business" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (fdl / fdl)
